title: Thanksgiving Day, 2025
summary: Proclamation 10994 of November 25, 2025, declares Thursday, November 27, 2025, as a National Day of Thanksgiving. The proclamation draws parallels between historical observances of Thanksgiving by Presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln and the current national spirit. It highlights perceived national achievements, including economic recovery, reduced cost of living, global peace, restored sovereignty, and a resurgent American spirit. The document encourages Americans to gather and offer prayers of thanks, emphasizing gratitude to God and a commitment to building a future that honors the sacrifices of past generations as the nation approaches its 250th anniversary of independence.
